required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Non-viable Oocytes, Extra Spermatozoa, Developmentally Arrested Non-viable Embryos, Granulosa Cells, Serum, Follicular Fluid, and Conditioned IVF Media for Optimization of Laboratory Technology in Assisted Reproduction

lead_sponsor.agency: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: Use of excess materials generally discarded in the process of undergoing IVF treatment to further develop and validate laboratory techniques.

detailed_description.textblock: 1- Testing methods or freezing eggs and/or sperm before implementing techniques. 2- Develop cell surgery and micromanipulation techniques. 3- Develop methods to optimize the determinations of genes and chromosomes in embryos. 4- Quality-assess laboratory equipment. 5- Test proficiency of laboratory staff. 6- Analyze what effects the early development of gametes and embryos. 7- Develop new methods and media to allow for higher survival rates of gametes and embryos. 8- Develop non-invasive tests for predicting oocyte and embryo quality to predict IVF success.

primary_outcome.measure: Methods for freezing sperm, eggs and/or embryos
primary_outcome.description: To test, standardize and implement better methods for the freezing of sperm, eggs, and/or embryos prior to these techniques being used in the clinical setting

secondary_outcome.description: The use of discarded tissues such as granulosa cells, conditioned media etc. to develop non-invasive tests for predicting oocyte and embryo quality as well as IVF success

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors that control gametes and embryos
secondary_outcome.description: To analyze gametes and embryos to learn more about what controls their early development and function.

biospec_descr.textblock: Discarded non-viable oocytes, granulosa cells, spermatozoa, developmentally arrested embryos, serum, follicular fluid, and conditioned IVF media.

overall_official.affiliation: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

facility.name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of new Jersey

link.description: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey
